title: Black Stone Cherry - Dortmund (Live) 2011 ak320
description:
Black Stone Cherry -  Dortmund (Live) 2011 ak320

Dortmund, Germany-February 12, 2016–Black Stone Cherry
What a great way to spend a Friday night out. I had never seen Black Stone Cherry live so far (yes, shame on me) but I heard a lot about them being an awesome live act. So I was accordingly curious. To cut to the point, I was not disappointed at all.

But let’s start from the beginning….The venue (1,500 people can fit in there) was really crowded right from the beginning. A wide range of people of different age and music taste crowded into the venue and were obviously all Rock’n’Roll music lovers.

7.00 p.m. sharp, the lights went out and the support band approached the stage. Actually I was expecting to see Theory of a Deadman but it was a British band called Toseland instead.  But nevertheless everybody was awaiting Black Stone Cherry to come on. And how they did it, opening the show with “Me and Mary Jane”. They ruled the gig from the very first second! I could feel the energetic fun the guys had with every single tone they performed. The music was wild, spontaneous, dirty, fresh and loud…just a rock ‘n’ roll should be!

Guitarist Ben Wells and bassist Jon Lawton were like bouncing balls, hurtling over the stage. The powerful pounding drummer John Fred Young swirled his drumsticks around that it was like a bursting firework flames. Singer Chris Robertson was a calming fixing point that maintained his stature between his band mates–but his limited action was made up by his even, nonetheless forceful singing and guitar playing.

Its no wonder that this band is going to the next level.


01 Blind Man
02 Rain Wizard
03 Backwoods Gold
04 Peace Is Free
05 White Trash Millionaire
06 Audience Jam
07 Maybe Someday
08 Blame It On The Boom Boom
09 Lonely Train

tt: 41:05


    Chris Robertson – lead vocals, lead and rhythm guitar
    Ben Wells – rhythm and lead guitar, backing vocals
    Jon Lawhon – bass guitar, backing vocals
    John Fred Young – drums, percussion, piano, backing vocals
